intro: Palicourea balnearia, commonly known as the beach palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand saline and coastal conditions. Palicourea balnearia plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
